{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3021769,"name":"Carter Steggerda","username":"steggs85","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/90ced4/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-12T23:44:33.324Z","cooked":"

Shout-out to Team 85’s amazing pit crew!!! Here’s a list of what they did at our event this weekend:

Before Quals: Added mouse trap flippy thingy, changed out four wheels
1st Match: Fixed mecanum wheels
2nd Match: Re-assembled and mounted the whole acceptor mechanism
3rd Match: Replaced snapped intake gussets
4th Match: Re-mounted intake gussets with steel rivets and added more supports
5th Match: Replaced limit switch and added spacers
6th Match: Nothing
7th Match: Remade intake lift gearbox
8th Match: Replaced back wheels and fixed oblong holes
9th Match: Remade intake lift gearbox again with a custom shaft
10th Match: Started planning for complete new intake retract subsystem
11th Match: Continued working on new intake lift and replaced intake limit switch
12th Match: Mounted new intake retract, made a new mounting spot for limit switch, tested intake retract, changed gear ratio, redid intake retract wiring
QF1: Scrambled while que volunteers yelled at us
QF2: Got pit crew kicked out because we didn’t know the rules
SF1: Got pit crew back out and set up battery cart
SF2: Saw that the mouse trap intake flippy thing was broken and threw it in the robot and forgot about it because we got knocked out

Feel free to add on to this thread with a list of what your amazing pit crew has done
